reviews.title: wonderful stay
reviews.text: What wonderful staff, really helpful, couldn't do enough. Amazing rooms, if you're staying nr. Mudeford or Leamington - perfect.
We booked a single (small double) and a larger double.
reviews.title: good & bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was excellent and the rooms are reasonably sized and appointed. Decoration was good but the shower in the larger double had mould around some of the bottom seal.
reviews.title: An Excellent Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one dark and very, very wet weekend in February. We reserved 2 days before and were please to be able to reserve the best room in the house - the Garden Suite for around 200 GBP.
reviews.title: Great Spot To Relax And Explore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is easy to find, being right next to the castle and short drive to the nearby beaches. Parking was fine during our stay and you can park across the road in the church car park if your late coming in on a busy restaurant night.
reviews.title: So - So

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Graden Suite is a great room - after a bracing walk on the beach we settled down to a great evening in our suites lounge with a bottle of wine and warm fire.
reviews.title: Only the one nighter but absolutely brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lets you get on with your stay - all the rooms are tastefully decorated but it is the suites that are a little special - ours had its own garden which would be fantastic in the summer - though you do experience some traffic noise from the main road close by.
reviews.title: Great for a short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was high quality, quick and relaxing. We did eat in the restaurant one evening. We found the food tasty but a little over elaborate at times. Service was spot on - friendly but not false. Pricing was fair and not excessive.
reviews.title: Bute-iful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on 27 June for our 23rd Wedding Anniversary. This was our third visit and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Lovely room, huge bathroom, king size bed, spa bath, upmarket toiletries, flat screen TV, air con. Everything you could want! We had dinner in the restaurant. My husband had crab to start and I had a wonderful goats cheese and spinach souffle. We both had beef wellington for our main course. I'd love to comment on the sweet, but we were much too full! In the past I've had fantastic creme brulee there and my husband has the cheese board - about half a pound of assorted cheeses and biscuits. It really was excellent. The service was efficient and friendly. The breakfast on Sunday was lovely. Choice of cereals or mixed fruit and yoghurt, full English, loads of toast and excellent coffee.This hotel is perfect for a romantice get a way. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: It was fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in June in a large ensuite. The room was spacious. The bathroom was nice but I was disapointed that our spa bath wasn't working. The hotel staff didn't fix it during our stay but they did give us a bottle of wine to compensate. We went to the restaurant on our second night - my advice is don't bother. The service is good but the food isn't michelin starred at all, it tasted like a ready meal! The food at the pub/bar next door is much better and also much cheaper.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't sure whether to give the hotel 3 or 4 out of 5, but as our spa bath wasn't working and the restaurant was awful, I've given it 3.
reviews.title: New Forest luxury
Simple luxury
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on our wedding night and for one night after (I'd also stayed the night before) with a number of our guests staying for 2 nights at the same time - beware, that I'm not sure that the Lord Bute will allow wedding parties to stay unless the reception is held there too, but things were different 9 months ago.....

Anyway, the hotel was fantastic - we were well looked after, even being allowed to join the end of a chartity function on the eve of the big day to have a drink in the bar. Breakfasts were great and it's a shame that we didn't need a dinner as I'm sure it would've been great. Having had the benefit of staying in two rooms over three days, I can thoroughly recommend both the family room (the coachhouse perhaps??) and the Lord Bute suite - both very nicely decorated and very comfortable.
reviews.title: On the third visit ...

likes.liked: — Lovely accommodation in a very convenient spot for New Forest exploration.
likes.disliked: — Can be very quiet feel a bit bereft when staff leave.

reviews.text: had a couple of nights here in August. Had the Coachouse room which was a really well appointed triple, with a nice bathroom and that also has a mini kitchen downstairs with a washing machine etc. Problems with the telly but the owner sorted them out, and incidentally, she was a really nice lady. You are in the roof of an old building effectively, so probably not the best for really tall people. Also quite near the road, which is quite busy, so you would struggle to sleep if you had the skylight open
reviews.title: Nice accomodation

likes.disliked: — the hotel is on a busy road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice king size bed, which was wonderfully comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast really nice. Also dined in the restauant in the evening - great food , and a very chatty jazz musician who was not too intrusive and was really nice to our little boy!
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel.......

reviews.text: A beautiful hotel, wonderful atmosphere and excellent food. We would certainly recommend this hotel and have every intention of making a return visit. The staff were warm and friendly and couldn't do enough to assist.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked three nights at the Lord Bute Hotel as we were getting married at the nearby Highcliffe Castle.
reviews.title: Pity about the food

likes.liked: — Room and bathroom confortable & clean. Service fiendly & efficient.
